means: 鲜艳夺目地，俗不可耐地

sentence.Network_en: The temple was garishly decorated with bright plastic flowers.
sentence.Network_cn: 鲜艳的塑料花把教堂装扮得很华丽.

PerfectNetExp.abs: garish中文 ... garish 炫耀的 garishly 华丽地 ... gingham 方格花布.

entry.def: You describe something as garish when you dislike it because it is very bright in an unattractive, showy way.

example.ex: They climbed the garish purple-carpeted stairs.
example.tran: 他们登上铺着俗艳的紫色地毯的楼梯。

sentences.sentence: "the temple was garishly decorated with bright plastic flowers"

auth_sentence.content: He stared at her plump breasts, at the dark tip of her cleavage that showed through her blouse, at her garishly painted lips.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He stared at her plump breasts, at the dark tip of her cleavage that showed through her blouse, at her garishly painted lips.

auth_sentence.content: In his frayed jeans, white T-shirt and garishly printed overshirt, Neil is older, heftier and perhaps wiser.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: In his frayed jeans, white T-shirt and garishly printed overshirt, Neil is older, heftier and perhaps wiser.

auth_sentence.content: She smiled garishly at her father and revealed the yellowed acrylic night guard snapped into place over her perfect incisors.
